subject: Re: [junit] Multiple assertions per test
msgSnippet: Argh, I meant to write Assertion#assertDriverResponseDone, not assertDrverResponse. My bad. assertTrue(driverResponse.isDone()) is the next logical step in the
messageBody:
Argh, I meant to write Assertion#assertDriverResponseDone, not
assertDrverResponse. My bad.

assertTrue(driverResponse.isDone()) is the next logical step in the
refactoring, but the object is generated by JAXB... and the code I'm
talking to doesn't guarantee it won't be null, contain a status value
within a given range, etc. So Assertion#assertDriverResponseDone is a
necessary facade on top of Assert#assertNotNull, an
Assertion#assertTrue() on String#contains, etc. Otherwise I end up with
multiple assertions again, and we're right back where we started. :S
--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/
